author: Jacob Siegal
title: How to get over 100 Nintendo Switch games for 20 cents each this weekend
text:
Over the past few months, we have all had the chance to expand our library of Nintendo Switch games rather significantly with all of QubicGames’ giveaways . This Friday, the publisher is back with another promotion, but you’ll have to take out your wallet for this one. To celebrate its 20th anniversary, QubicGames is marking down over 100 Switch games to just 20 cents a piece starting on Friday, April 12th at 9 AM PT / 12 PM ET. You will be able to find all the deeply discounted games by searching for QubicGames on the Nintendo eShop . As always, there’s a slight catch if you want to participate. You need to own one of six games in order to get the rest of the games on sale. The games are Robonauts , Pocket Mini Golf , Pocket Mini Golf 2 , Hole io , Geki Yaba Runner Anniversary Edition , and Coloring Book . If you’ve taken part in any of the previous QubicGames giveaways, you probably already own one or more of these games, but if not, you can still download Coloring Book for free . As long as you own one of those games, you can go on a cheap shopping spree on the eShop this weekend. You’ll be able to find the full list of the discounted games on QubicGames.com/20 as of Friday, but in the meantime, you can see some of the titles in the video above, including Real Boxing 2 , Mana Spark , and Good Night, Knight . Sign up for the most interesting tech & entertainment news out there. Email:
SIGN UP By signing up, I agree to the Terms of Use and have reviewed the Privacy Notice. With such a huge selection available, you should be able to find at least a few new titles to add to your Switch library for a rainy day. After all, stocking up on 25 new games will cost you just $5, which is less than one-tenth of the price of most new games. (via GoNintendo )

author: Gareth Finighan
title: OBA questions Premier over ‘fairer society’ claims - The Royal Gazette | Bermuda News, Business, Sports, Events, & Community |
text:
Reset Password Home Coronavirus Covid-19 In-depth News Business Sport Opinion Navigate Bermuda RG Podcast RG Fantasy League Lifestyle Jobs Classifieds Obituaries Weather Newsrack RGmags Drive For Change Search Log in Log out Activate My account Subscribe ePaper Newsletter Advertise Terms of Service BERMUDA | RSS PODCAST Log in My Profile Logout Log in Activate My account Subscribe ePaper Newsletter Advertise Search News Ending Homelessness Year in Review Bermuda Budget Coronavirus Covid-19 In-depth Drive for Change Court Crime Education Entertainment Environment General Health Labour Politics Tourism Transport Weather Business Navigate Bermuda Banking Bermuda Stock Exchange Economy General International Business Local Business Personal Finance Re-Insurance Technology Sport Flora Duffy RG Fantasy League Basketball Boxing Cricket Cycling Equestrian General Golf Gymnastics Motor Sports Rugby Running/Triathlon Sailing Soccer Swimming Tennis/Squash Track & Field Lifestyle Arts & Entertainment Community Fashion Food & Wine General Home & Away Religion Wellness Opinion Bermuda Youth Connect Editorials Letters to the Editor Opinion Writer Political Cartoons Classifieds Jobs Obituaries RGmags RG Business Magazine RG Business Top Ten Subscribe 74a4fe1c-fe3c-46fb-860a-7869a4c74673 OBA questions Premier over ‘fairer society’ claims Gareth Finighan Created: Oct 24, 2024 06:08 PM Questions: Jarion Richardson, the leader of the One Bermuda Alliance (File photograph by Blaire Simmons) The Opposition has hit back at claims by the Premier that Bermuda is a fairer society under the Government’s stewardship.
Jarion Richardson, the leader of the One Bermuda Alliance, spoke out after David Burt delivered an address at the Progressive Labour Party’s Annual Delegates Conference last night.
Mr Burt reminded the audience that his administration had raised pensions and cut taxes since coming to office in 2017.
He told the party faithful: “We have proven that government can and should be a force for good in people’s lives and one that can fight for fairness in society.
“We are committed to progress, fairness and equity, and to policies that benefit all Bermudians.”
Today Mr Richardson questioned that claim, instead painting a picture of crumbling infrastructure and failing government services.
He said: “Bermudians must have listened to Premier Burt’s comments to PLP party delegates wondering if he’s on the same planet.
“In what world does he think life is fairer for working Bermudians under the PLP’s 20-year race to the bottom?
“Instead, the PLP has gifted Bermuda with under-resourced schools, escalating healthcare, crumbling roads and bridges and understaffed government services.”
Mr Richardson pointed out that Bermudians were leaving the island “in droves” because of financial hardship.
He said: “Premier Burt’s so-called ‘sweeping changes for equality’ seem to have swept away everything Bermudians value about this island — pride in the excellence of our education, pride in our well-maintained roads and buildings and pride in the fact that families can create a decent standard of living for themselves.
“The PLP’s notion of fairness has not brought prosperity to the people who gave it power. It has made life much worse.”
Mr Richardson said that poor governance had “run this country into the ground”, but that good governance could “turn it back around again.
He added that the solution to creating a fairer Bermuda was to fix the basics of good government.
He said: “That means creating an environment where investors want to come here, and cutting taxes and red tape to help local businesses thrive; delivering a world-class education for our children; investing in our roads and infrastructure to bring Bermuda back to where it should be, and reducing our crippling national debt.
“Most importantly and the most basic of all, is governing with integrity and accountability — and being accountable to the people who put you in government.
“If Premier Burt wants a fairer Bermuda, he needs to stop wasting time complaining about the ‘combined opposition’ and start fixing the problems that his government created.”
Related Stories Premier warns of ‘new Combined Opposition’ Parliament to reconvene early next month Commissiong mulls standing as an independent

author: @MikeGtzM
title: Este bocina magnética cuesta menos de 299 pesos, tiene luz LED y es ideal para duplicar la potencia de...
text:
En Mercado Libre es posible encontrar una amplia gama de bocinas portátiles para todo tipo de usuarios. Por ejemplo, si lo que buscas es una alternativa resistente que te de la mejor relación precio potencia, está la Xdobo Rainbow II. O bien, en el caso de que prefieras algo más práctico, este mini altavoz magnético BMLT Maglit puede ser la opción para ti por solo 286 pesos.
Bocina magnética BMLT Maglit
Si hablamos de especificaciones técnicas, la bocina cuenta con 4W de potencia, mismos que se pueden complementar al utilizar su función TWS que nos permitirá vincular dos altavoces del mismo modelo. Además, promete una autonomía de entre tres a cinco horas dependiendo del volumen de uso y se conecta mediante Bluetooth 5 a nuestros dispositivos.
Aunque, el aspecto más destacable de este modelo es su posibilidad de acoplarse a un anillo magnético como el MagSafe que traen de fábrica los iPhone, o el que podemos encontrar en las fundas de varios teléfonos Android. Además, la Maglit viene retroiluminada con una anillo de luz LED ambar y tiene resistencia contra salpicaduras.
Todo lo anterior, hace de este accesorio una variante ideal para aquellos que buscan elevar su experiencia de consumo de contenido de su smartphone o tablet. Aunque si tu prioridad está en la potencia de audio, puedes inclinar tu opción de compra por alguna de las otras opciones de la marca como la Xdobo X7 de 50W por 715 pesos.
En |

Because you have forgotten.
Forgiveness
is one of the most profound teachings of Jesus. In the Gospel of Matthew (18:21-22), Peter asked Jesus how often he should forgive someone who sins against him. Jesus replied, "I tell you, not seven times, but seventy-seven times," signifying that forgiveness should be limitless. His teaching emphasized that one should always forgive others, even if they continually make mistakes or cause harm. The parable of the Prodigal Son in Luke (15:11-32) illustrates this point where the father forgives his wayward son upon his repentance and return, emphasizing the unconditional nature of forgiveness.
In terms of
tolerance
, Jesus taught love and acceptance for all, even those who were shunned by society. In the story of the Good Samaritan (Luke 10:25-37), a man left for dead on the roadside is ignored by a priest and a Levite, but a Samaritan, a figure despised by the J ish people at the time, stops to help him. This parable taught that one's neighbor is not only those who are similar to oneself but everyone, including those who are different or even despised. It highlights the importance of compassion, tolerance, and empathy towards all beings.
As for
humility
, Jesus himself was the embodiment of this virtue. He was born in a humble manger and lived a simple life. In Matthew (20:25-28), Jesus taught that "whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant". He also said, "The Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve." This served to emphasize that greatness comes from humbly serving others rather than seeking personal glory. Jesus' washing of his disciples' feet, as described in John (13:1-17), is a powerful symbol of humility. Despite being their master and teacher, Jesus assumed the role of a servant to teach the virtue of humility.
